intro: Senecio acroleucus, commonly known as the orange ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and serrated, hairy leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Senecio acroleucus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
